rule.name: Unknown NOLINT error category: %s % category
rule.description: Unknown NOLINT error category: %s % category

rule.name: Small and focused functions are preferred: %s has %d non-comment lines (error triggered by exceeding %d lines). % (self.current_function, self.lines_in_function, trigger)
rule.description: Small and focused functions are preferred: %s has %d non-comment lines (error triggered by exceeding %d lines). % (self.current_function, self.lines_in_function, trigger)

rule.name: Could not find end of multi-line comment
rule.description: Could not find end of multi-line comment

rule.name: No copyright message found. You should have a line: "Copyright [year] <Copyright Owner>"
rule.description: No copyright message found. You should have a line: "Copyright [year] <Copyright Owner>"

rule.name: No #ifndef header guard found, suggested CPP variable is: %s % cppvar
rule.description: No #ifndef header guard found, suggested CPP variable is: %s % cppvar

rule.name: No #define header guard found, suggested CPP variable is: %s % cppvar
rule.description: No #define header guard found, suggested CPP variable is: %s % cppvar

rule.name: #ifndef header guard has wrong style, please use: %s % cppvar
rule.description: #ifndef header guard has wrong style, please use: %s % cppvar

rule.name: #ifndef and #define don\ t match, suggested CPP variable is: %s % cppvar
rule.description: #ifndef and #define don\ t match, suggested CPP variable is: %s % cppvar

rule.name: #endif line should be "#endif // %s" % cppvar
rule.description: #endif line should be "#endif // %s" % cppvar

rule.name: Line contains invalid UTF-8 (or Unicode replacement character).
rule.description: Line contains invalid UTF-8 (or Unicode replacement character).

rule.name: Could not find a newline character at the end of the file.
rule.description: Could not find a newline character at the end of the file.

rule.name: Complex multi-line /*...*/-style comment found. Lint may give bogus warnings. Consider replacing these with //-style comments, with #if 0...#endif, or with more clearly structured multi-line
rule.description: Complex multi-line /*...*/-style comment found. Lint may give bogus warnings. Consider replacing these with //-style comments, with #if 0...#endif, or with more clearly structured multi-line comments.

rule.name: Multi-line string ("...") found. This lint script doesn\ t do well with such strings, and may give bogus warnings. They\ re ugly and unnecessary, and you should use concatenation instead".
rule.description: Multi-line string ("...") found. This lint script doesn\ t do well with such strings, and may give bogus warnings. They\ re ugly and unnecessary, and you should use concatenation instead".

rule.name: Consider using + multithread_safe_function + ...) instead of + single_thread_function + ...) for improved thread safety.
rule.description: Consider using + multithread_safe_function + ...) instead of + single_thread_function + ...) for improved thread safety.

rule.name: Changing pointer instead of value (or unused value of operator*).
rule.description: Changing pointer instead of value (or unused value of operator*).

rule.name: Namespace should be terminated with "// namespace %s" %self.Name
rule.description: Namespace should be terminated with "// namespace %s" %self.Name

rule.name: Namespace should be terminated with "// namespace"
rule.description: Namespace should be terminated with "// namespace"

rule.name: Failed to find complete declaration of class %s %obj.Name
rule.description: Failed to find complete declaration of class %s %obj.Name

rule.name: %q in format strings is deprecated. Use %ll instead.
rule.description: %q in format strings is deprecated. Use %ll instead.

rule.name: %N$ formats are unconventional. Try rewriting to avoid them.
rule.description: %N$ formats are unconventional. Try rewriting to avoid them.

rule.name: %, [, (, and { are undefined character escapes. Unescape them.
rule.description: %, [, (, and { are undefined character escapes. Unescape them.

rule.name: Storage class (static, extern, typedef, etc) should be first.
rule.description: Storage class (static, extern, typedef, etc) should be first.

rule.name: Uncommented text after #endif is non-standard. Use a comment.
rule.description: Uncommented text after #endif is non-standard. Use a comment.

rule.name: Inner-style forward declarations are invalid. Remove this line.
rule.description: Inner-style forward declarations are invalid. Remove this line.

rule.name: >? and <? (max and min) operators are non-standard and deprecated.
rule.description: >? and <? (max and min) operators are non-standard and deprecated.

rule.name: const string& members are dangerous. It is much better to use alternatives, such as pointers or simple constants.
rule.description: const string& members are dangerous. It is much better to use alternatives, such as pointers or simple constants.

rule.name: Single-argument constructors should be marked explicit.
rule.description: Single-argument constructors should be marked explicit.

rule.name: Extra space after ( in function call
rule.description: Extra space after ( in function call

rule.name: Extra space after (
rule.description: Extra space after (

rule.name: Extra space before ( in function call
rule.description: Extra space before ( in function call

rule.name: Closing ) should be moved to the previous line
rule.description: Closing ) should be moved to the previous line

rule.name: Extra space before )
rule.description: Extra space before )

rule.name: Disabled Tests should include Test Track Reference in Name, Ex: DISABLED_TT50923_TestName
rule.description: Disabled Tests should include Test Track Reference in Name, Ex: DISABLED_TT50923_TestName

rule.name: Lint failed to find start of function body.
rule.description: Lint failed to find start of function body.

rule.name: Too many spaces before TODO
rule.description: Too many spaces before TODO

rule.name: Missing username in TODO; it should look like "// TODO(my_username): Stuff."
rule.description: Missing username in TODO; it should look like "// TODO(my_username): Stuff."

rule.name: TODO(my_username) should be followed by a space
rule.description: TODO(my_username) should be followed by a space

rule.name: %s must be in the private: section % matched.group(1)
rule.description: %s must be in the private: section % matched.group(1)

rule.name: Blank line at the start of a code block. Is this needed?
rule.description: Blank line at the start of a code block. Is this needed?

rule.name: Blank line at the end of a code block. Is this needed?
rule.description: Blank line at the end of a code block. Is this needed?

rule.name: Do not leave a blank line after "%s:" % matched.group(1)
rule.description: Do not leave a blank line after "%s:" % matched.group(1)

rule.name: At least two spaces is best between code and comments
rule.description: At least two spaces is best between code and comments

rule.name: Should have a space between // and comment
rule.description: Should have a space between // and comment

rule.name: Missing spaces around =
rule.description: Missing spaces around =

rule.name: Missing spaces around %s % match.group(1)
rule.description: Missing spaces around %s % match.group(1)

rule.name: Missing spaces around <<
rule.description: Missing spaces around <<

rule.name: Missing spaces around <
rule.description: Missing spaces around <

rule.name: Missing spaces around >
rule.description: Missing spaces around >

rule.name: Missing spaces around %s % match.group(1)
rule.description: Missing spaces around %s % match.group(1)

rule.name: Extra space for operator %s % match.group(1)
rule.description: Extra space for operator %s % match.group(1)

rule.name: Missing space before ( in %s % match.group(1)
rule.description: Missing space before ( in %s % match.group(1)

rule.name: Mismatching spaces inside () in %s % match.group(1)
rule.description: Mismatching spaces inside () in %s % match.group(1)

rule.name: Should have zero or one spaces inside ( and ) in %s % match.group(1)
rule.description: Should have zero or one spaces inside ( and ) in %s % match.group(1)

rule.name: Missing space after ,
rule.description: Missing space after ,

rule.name: Missing space after ;
rule.description: Missing space after ;

rule.name: Missing space before {
rule.description: Missing space before {

rule.name: Missing space before else
rule.description: Missing space before else

rule.name: Extra space before [
rule.description: Extra space before [

rule.name: Semicolon defining empty statement. Use { } instead.
rule.description: Semicolon defining empty statement. Use { } instead.

rule.name: Line contains only semicolon. If this should be an empty statement, use { } instead.
rule.description: Line contains only semicolon. If this should be an empty statement, use { } instead.

rule.name: Extra space before last semicolon. If this should be an empty statement, use {} instead.
rule.description: Extra space before last semicolon. If this should be an empty statement, use {} instead.

rule.name: Missing space around colon in range-based for loop
rule.description: Missing space around colon in range-based for loop

rule.name: "%s:" should be preceded by a blank line % matched.group(1)
rule.description: "%s:" should be preceded by a blank line % matched.group(1)

rule.name: { should almost always be at the end of the previous line
rule.description: { should almost always be at the end of the previous line

rule.name: An else should appear on the same line as the preceding }
rule.description: An else should appear on the same line as the preceding }

rule.name: If an else has a brace on one side, it should have it on both
rule.description: If an else has a brace on one side, it should have it on both

rule.name: If an else has a brace on one side, it should have it on both
rule.description: If an else has a brace on one side, it should have it on both

rule.name: Else clause should never be on same line as else (use 2 lines)
rule.description: Else clause should never be on same line as else (use 2 lines)

rule.name: do/while clauses should not be on a single line
rule.description: do/while clauses should not be on a single line

rule.name: "You don t need a ; after a }"
rule.description: "You don t need a ; after a }"

rule.name: Empty loop bodies should use {} or continue
rule.description: Empty loop bodies should use {} or continue

rule.name: Consider using %s instead of %s(a %s b) % (_CHECK_REPLACEMENT[current_macro][operator], current_macro, operator)
rule.description: Consider using %s instead of %s(a %s b) % (_CHECK_REPLACEMENT[current_macro][operator], current_macro, operator)

rule.name: Use operator %s instead of %s % (_ALT_TOKEN_REPLACEMENT[match.group(1)], match.group(1))
rule.description: Use operator %s instead of %s % (_ALT_TOKEN_REPLACEMENT[match.group(1)], match.group(1))

rule.name: Tab found; better to use spaces
rule.description: Tab found; better to use spaces

rule.name: Line ends in whitespace. Consider deleting these extra spaces.
rule.description: Line ends in whitespace. Consider deleting these extra spaces.

rule.name: Weird number of spaces at line-start. Are you using a 2-space indent?
rule.description: Weird number of spaces at line-start. Are you using a 2-space indent?

rule.name: Labels should always be indented at least one space. If this is a member-initializer list in a constructor or the base class list in a class definition, the colon should be on the following li
rule.description: Labels should always be indented at least one space. If this is a member-initializer list in a constructor or the base class list in a class definition, the colon should be on the following line.

rule.name: Lines should very rarely be longer than 140 characters
rule.description: Lines should very rarely be longer than 140 characters

rule.name: Lines should be <= 120 characters long
rule.description: Lines should be <= 120 characters long

rule.name: More than one command on the same line
rule.description: More than one command on the same line

rule.name: Relative paths to parent directories in includes are not allowed - paths should be set in project files
rule.description: Relative paths to parent directories in includes are not allowed - paths should be set in project files

rule.name: IllegalIncludeDirectories: Include File is illegal in this Project: + invalidinclude
rule.description: IllegalIncludeDirectories: Include File is illegal in this Project: + invalidinclude

rule.name: "%s" already included at %s:%s % (include, filename, include_state[include])
rule.description: "%s" already included at %s:%s % (include, filename, include_state[include])

rule.name: %s. Should be: %s.h, c system, c++ system, other. % (error_message, fileinfo.BaseName())
rule.description: %s. Should be: %s.h, c system, c++ system, other. % (error_message, fileinfo.BaseName())

rule.name: Include "%s" not in alphabetical order % include
rule.description: Include "%s" not in alphabetical order % include

rule.name: Streams are highly discouraged.
rule.description: Streams are highly discouraged.

rule.name: SONAR_ARCHITECTURAL_VIOLATION: + error_msg
rule.description: SONAR_ARCHITECTURAL_VIOLATION: + error_msg

rule.name: SONAR_ARCHITECTURAL_VIOLATION BLOCK: + error_msg
rule.description: SONAR_ARCHITECTURAL_VIOLATION BLOCK: + error_msg

rule.name: Usage of unnamed + type + ::Usage of unnamed + type + . + type + should always have a name by Tekla coding guidelines
rule.description: Usage of unnamed + type + ::Usage of unnamed + type + . + type + should always have a name by Tekla coding guidelines

rule.name: Encoding Problems: Invalid character in range (TT #82382): %s % errormsg
rule.description: Encoding Problems: Invalid character in range (TT #82382): %s % errormsg

rule.name: Encoding Problems: Invalid character Used (TT #82382): %s % error_msg
rule.description: Encoding Problems: Invalid character Used (TT #82382): %s % error_msg

rule.name: Is this a non-const reference? If so, make const or use a pointer.
rule.description: Is this a non-const reference? If so, make const or use a pointer.

rule.name: Using deprecated casting style. Use static_cast<%s>(...) instead %match.group(2)
rule.description: Using deprecated casting style. Use static_cast<%s>(...) instead %match.group(2)

rule.name: ( Are you taking an address of a cast? This is dangerous: could be a temp var. Take the address before doing the cast, rather than after )
rule.description: ( Are you taking an address of a cast? This is dangerous: could be a temp var. Take the address before doing the cast, rather than after )

rule.name: For a static/global string constant, use a C style string instead: "%schar %s[]". % (match.group(1), match.group(2))
rule.description: For a static/global string constant, use a C style string instead: "%schar %s[]". % (match.group(1), match.group(2))

rule.name: Do not use dynamic_cast<>. If you need to cast within a class "hierarchy, use static_cast<> to upcast. Google doesn t support " RTTI.
rule.description: Do not use dynamic_cast<>. If you need to cast within a class "hierarchy, use static_cast<> to upcast. Google doesn t support " RTTI.

rule.name: You seem to be initializing a member variable with itself.
rule.description: You seem to be initializing a member variable with itself.

rule.name: Use "unsigned short" for ports, not "short"
rule.description: Use "unsigned short" for ports, not "short"

rule.name: Use int16/int64/etc, rather than the C type %s % match.group(1)
rule.description: Use int16/int64/etc, rather than the C type %s % match.group(1)

rule.name: If you can, use sizeof(%s) instead of %s as the 2nd arg to snprintf. % (match.group(1), match.group(2))
rule.description: If you can, use sizeof(%s) instead of %s as the 2nd arg to snprintf. % (match.group(1), match.group(2))

rule.name: sprintf from conversion namespace should not be used, windows sprintf_s should be use instead or Cxx11 snprintf when available
rule.description: sprintf from conversion namespace should not be used, windows sprintf_s should be use instead or Cxx11 snprintf when available

rule.name: Never use sprintf. Windows sprintf_s should be use instead, or cxx11 snprintf when available
rule.description: Never use sprintf. Windows sprintf_s should be use instead, or cxx11 snprintf when available

rule.name: Almost always, snprintf is better than %s % match.group(1)
rule.description: Almost always, snprintf is better than %s % match.group(1)

rule.name: sscanf from namespace conversion is deprecated, please find a suitable replacement
rule.description: sscanf from namespace conversion is deprecated, please find a suitable replacement

rule.name: sscanf can be ok, but is slow and can overflow buffers.
rule.description: sscanf can be ok, but is slow and can overflow buffers.

rule.name: Function has been marked as deprecated, please find a suitable replacement. ( + deprecated_Function + ) - Tekla Custom
rule.description: Function has been marked as deprecated, please find a suitable replacement. ( + deprecated_Function + ) - Tekla Custom

rule.name: Unary operator& is dangerous. Do not use it.
rule.description: Unary operator& is dangerous. Do not use it.

rule.name: Did you mean "else if"? If not, start a new line for "if".
rule.description: Did you mean "else if"? If not, start a new line for "if".

rule.name: Potential format string bug. Do %s("%%s", %s) instead. % (function_name, match.group(1))
rule.description: Potential format string bug. Do %s("%%s", %s) instead. % (function_name, match.group(1))

rule.name: Did you mean "memset(%s, 0, %s)"? % (match.group(1), match.group(2))
rule.description: Did you mean "memset(%s, 0, %s)"? % (match.group(1), match.group(2))

rule.name: Do not use namespace using-directives. Use using-declarations instead.
rule.description: Do not use namespace using-directives. Use using-declarations instead.

rule.name: Do not use variable-length arrays. Use an appropriately named "( k followed by CamelCase) compile-time constant for the size."
rule.description: Do not use variable-length arrays. Use an appropriately named "( k followed by CamelCase) compile-time constant for the size."

rule.name: match.group(1) + should be the last thing in the class
rule.description: match.group(1) + should be the last thing in the class

rule.name: Do not use unnamed namespaces in header files. See http://google-styleguide.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/cppguide.xml#Namespaces for more information.
rule.description: Do not use unnamed namespaces in header files. See http://google-styleguide.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/cppguide.xml#Namespaces for more information.

rule.name: Using sizeof(type). Use sizeof(varname) instead if possible
rule.description: Using sizeof(type). Use sizeof(varname) instead if possible

rule.name: All parameters should be named in a function
rule.description: All parameters should be named in a function

rule.name: Using C-style cast. Prefer static_cast<%s> if possible, if not use %s<%s>(...) instead % (match.group(1), cast_type, match.group(1))
rule.description: Using C-style cast. Prefer static_cast<%s> if possible, if not use %s<%s>(...) instead % (match.group(1), cast_type, match.group(1))

rule.name: Add #include + required_header_unstripped + for + template
rule.description: Add #include + required_header_unstripped + for + template

rule.name: Omit template arguments from make_pair OR use pair directly OR if appropriate, construct a pair directly
rule.description: Omit template arguments from make_pair OR use pair directly OR if appropriate, construct a pair directly

rule.name: One or more unexpected \\r (^M) found; better to use only a \\n
rule.description: One or more unexpected \\r (^M) found; better to use only a \\n

rule.name: Source files are restricted to a maximum of 1500 lines of code
rule.description: Source files are restricted to a maximum of 1500 lines of code

rule.name: Header files are restricted to a maximum of 300 lines of code
rule.description: Header files are restricted to a maximum of 300 lines of code
